website_summaries.verdict: Highly reputable brand that delivers this super secure, quality sax stand.
pros: Trusted by musicians to stay put on the stage
Adjustable neck and base to custom fit your tenor or alto sax
Folds up small and comes with a bag for transport
cons: Doesn’t come with a clarinet peg, although similar models from this brand do

customer_reviews.title: Great for tenors
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to thoroughly research stands. I went with the Hercules because other reviewers noted it for strength. They were right! I am very pleased with this stand. I am using it for an old Martin tenor, and it holds it without issue. I also tried it with my Yamaha alto, works fine as well. I couldn't be happier with this stand. I would recommend this item to anyone. To those leery of paying a higher price than others that look similar, I urge you to delve into those reviews and note a common theme - inferior product, unsteady, cheap materials, etc. This product is none of those, and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Yager

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, nice bag, wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: The traveling bag is a nice touch. Solidly built, this stand inspires confidence... until I put my saxophone on it. I've used two different saxes and both times I have to wait to make sure they won't slide and rotate. The reason I purchased this stand over others was due to reviewers assuring us that this specific issue wouldn't be a problem. It is. Buy something else if you want a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: temetvince

customer_reviews.title: Prefer this sax stand for my Alto horn
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with my Yamaha YAS-62 alto. Love it. However I also own a Cannonball Tenor Big Bell Stone Series. The larger bell gets stuck in the upper bracket. I pickup the Tenor & the Hercules stand comes right with it. I suppose if I bend the top bracket wider then it could work. Luckily I have another sax stand which does not get stuck at all and quite stable. This stand also has a Hollywood Curved Soprano bracket. Now I have all 3 instruments out of their case and ready to play Smooth Jazz.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: This is a very solid sturdy stand -- much better than my old one
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid sturdy stand -- much better than my old one, which I put up with for several years till it finally dumped my [tenor] sax off the stage one day. It feels like it would take an earthquake to dislodge an instrument from this one. One reviewer complained, at least mildly, about the appearance. Personally, I think it looks quite sharp. Have had it a couple months now and, so far at least, I'm 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Bay

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Stand
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my old Hamilton stand. A very nice unit. My only complaints- the tenor sticks to the cradle some, so it's a good idea to step on a foot when picking up the horn, to avoid pulling the stand off the floor- especially if you have a flute or clarinet on the peg. On the other hand, it holds a tenor or alto sax securely. I feel that the lower rest should be wider. It's too easy to miss it and have your horn put in danger.
customer_reviews.author: Warren A. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great stand. Sturdy and folds up small enough to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great stand. Sturdy and folds up small enough to fit inside my hard case! If it won't fit in your case, the it's included bag can be slung over your shoulder to carry to you gig. The bell brace at the bottom always has me wondering if I've set it in the right place but it is very adjustable to fit any tenor or alto horn. Good for keeping your sax out and available to practice more. It's utilitarian, not decorative, tho... if you want something that compliments your living room, I saw a wooden one on Amazon, somewhere but, for the studio or the stage, this one is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: bLaKouT

customer_reviews.title: Would not change a thing!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the wait it was shipped in from UK packaged extremely well I'm very impressed it is easy to set up and to break down also has a little carrying bag
customer_reviews.author: ccdubb6

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made!
customer_reviews.text: I had another brand that was very similar in appearance but was made more cheaply and if not very careful when placing it on the stand, it would tip over. This Hercules stand is very sturdy and holds the sax tightly in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bobba74

customer_reviews.title: This Stand is a Keeper
customer_reviews.text: This was ordered for my daughter to use in the Easter brass & woodwind concert at church. Right away she triedher Alto saxophone on the stand and loved it. It clicks into place after being unfolded and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C Little

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, compact Alto stand, that's also adjustable for different sized instruments!
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned because I've found some Hercules stands to have too large of a base in the past - I also have a bass clarinet stand. But this is quite compact! It's adjustable - neck and base - so you can fit different-sized Altos on it. I have not tried Tenor, but it should fit fine. It's also quite sturdy - does NOT wobble! Inexpensive, too! It's so well-made, I may not have to buy one again for a LONG time. Highly recommend. If you need a doubler's stand, I believe they make other versions that include pegs/accessories, too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Seltzer

customer_reviews.title: Super stand!
customer_reviews.text: Solid and steady. Holds my tenor well. Only thing is that the little rest at the bottom flips up easily, so careful when putting your sax down.
customer_reviews.author: Mr./Mrs. B.

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY sturdy stand, with option for alto or tenor. Plus, I managed to get a clarinet peg, which easily screws into it. The stand remains steady and stable. (Hooray!) It is easy to put 'up' and 'take down', simply depress a 'button' or two. The only 'weakness' is that it collapses to an awkward shape, and I had to be very creative to get it into my tenor case. But, should I loose it, I'd get another one in a heartbeat. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Carlton

customer_reviews.title: however it's been holding my alto safe and sound for weeks and weeks without any problems - I just make sure to hold on to it un
customer_reviews.text: First stand I've had; I've been wanting one for years but didn't really have a need until recently...It is a little loose on the bell, which made me nervous as other reviewers have said, however it's been holding my alto safe and sound for weeks and weeks without any problems - I just make sure to hold on to it until it's sitting at just the right angle - but that literally takes like 5-10 seconds, so no big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: MuffinandPuffin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Well i already knew Hercules its a great product so my expectations were high. Now for who ever cares about the packaging, it did come in the original packaging from warehouse. Also i thought the stand was going to be a bit taller or higher so i wouldn't have to bend over alot but i was wrong its good but i wish i it had an adjustment to make it higher so i wont reach very low. but would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: eangel2010

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Band Directors
customer_reviews.text: I'm an elementary band director and was looking for something that would hold my saxophone. I read the reviews on the other stands and wasn't impressed. I decided to pay the extra money and get the Hercules brand. Considering my classroom environment and it's durability, it was a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong Sax Stand!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent stand for my Tenor Sax. The construction is very sturdy and I don't feel uneasy when I set my sax down. There is still slight movement when placing on hook, but I don't get the feeling that it may tip over. You can't go wrong with this stand. price is slightly higher than other stands, but it is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Great stand. It isn't as beautiful as some stands, looks industrial, but BUILT LIKE A TANK
customer_reviews.text: Great stand. It isn't as beautiful as some stands, looks industrial, but BUILT LIKE A TANK, seriously. It is rock solid and easy to fold/unfold. And compact when folded and put in its bag. I use it for a TENOR sax.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly solid
customer_reviews.text: After my band's road manager lost my previous generic saxophone stand, I figured it was time to upgrade. I was very surprised to see that, for about the same price as a generic stand (at least on Amazon), I could get one of these tough little Hercules things, which a friend of mine had recommended to me several years ago. I couldn't be happier with it. It's strong, solid, stable, and it folds up into a surprisingly compact and portable little rectangle that I can stick in my keyboard gigbag or backpack. It doesn't have a flute peg, but that's not a big deal to me. I'm very pleased with it, and the price I got was absolutely awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Donohoe

customer_reviews.title: Great for a modern tenor
customer_reviews.text: Very stable. Holds my Yamaha Custom tenor quite well and I have no concerns of it falling over. Would recommend this to anyone who needs a stand for a modern tenor sax. Be careful– if you have a vintage tenor with a different neck curve, it might not hold your sax well according to some of these other reviews. However for an alto or modern tenor, this stand is great!
customer_reviews.author: Drew H. Matamales

customer_reviews.title: The tenor bell fits great..
customer_reviews.text: The tenor bell fits great.... the alto bell, not so much. It still stays on the stand but is not a snug fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect stand for our young saxophone player to be able ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect stand for our young saxophone player to be able to travel with the other collapses and it holds the fax on perfectly so that no keys are hitting any part of the stand
customer_reviews.author: S. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tenor Sax
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my tenor sax and I am loving it - I can't attest to how this holds an alto but you will not be dissapointed if you get this for your tenor. Very sturdy and never worry about my saxophone falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Ann Baker

customer_reviews.title: The bag helps for storage and the strap is great for
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I purchased for my tenor sax Also fits my alto sax I have a total of 2 same model. The bag helps for storage and the strap is great for transport
customer_reviews.author: Cov

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to use stand
customer_reviews.text: Got this stand so my daughter could leave her sax out at home and not worry so much about knocking of a desk or chair. As one music teacher said, the more accessible an instrument is, the more likely it will be played. So far, that idea is working and so does the stand. Based on the quality of construction, I feel it is reasonably priced. Never having purchased one before, I cannot give a detailed comparison... I did go for the slightly more expensive version and I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: W. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Portable yet sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a place to safely out my sax during breaks on stage. I also like to keep my sax in the fresh air not case after cleaning it; I find this stand does the job fir both my purposes. At first it was not easy to fold, but the buttons you press down seem easier each time, but dtill lock back in place securely when I unfold it.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality stand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stand for my Tenor Saxophone for performances. I had purchased the flute one from the same company a while ago and loved it, so I went with Hercules again. I was not disappointed with this stand! My sax sits snugly on the stand and it is made of sturdy metal and I know my instrument is secure! It also fold compact enough to store inside of my case which make it easier to carry with me everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.  Compact and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to encourage him to practice since he wouldn't have to disassemble the sax and put it away. This folds up really small, so it is portable if need be, and is very sturdy. It is only about 18 tall, so it doesn't stand up as high as I expected, but that is not a bad thing. The feet lock into place and support the instrument without wobbling. Hightly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Weight Worth It for Stability
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised; much sturdier, albeit heavier, than other models. The weight is well worth it for the stability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this stand for my alto sax. It is well made and works quite well at home... and then folds up well for travel. It is well made and sturdy plus very easy to place the sax down when I need to do something else. I recommend it especially for any sax player that commonly uses two woodwinds during gigs.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, works
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to set up. Sometimes the little push buttons are hard to get to retract but not bad. Holds the sax fine. Takes up very little space when folded up.
customer_reviews.author: postscript

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but conveniently collapses
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality product--very heavy, but collapses to fit in a small carrying bag. I didn't realize how convenient it would be to have a stand, but now I don't want to be without it. It is well worth the money. The other musicians that I play with recommended this brand, and they were right!
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Fully satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I already have two sax-stands. I tend to transport them as little as possible, just to avoid the "taking apart and putting together" exercise. I bought this stand without a clear idea of how it'd "fit in" with my routine. Now, I find that I use it everywhere I go, and leave the others "assembled" in a convenient location. I particularly like the "one piece" aspect of this stand as well as it's compactness. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: saxdoubler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and sturdy stand for alto / tenor sax! Folds easily, and really snaps into place.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Clarke

customer_reviews.title: look's great. also has a bag for transportation stand
customer_reviews.text: Very quality, strong, it's not high, and it's very safe. look's great. also has a bag for transportation stand, very comfortable. it's my favorite stand which i had for alto saxophone.
customer_reviews.author: Nino Berishvili

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for my husband and it was a perfect for his YAS62 Yamaha Alto Sax
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and it was a perfect for his YAS62 Yamaha Alto Sax. Its sturdy and he loved it. I would recommend if you have the YAS62 to purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well-made
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and stable. You can add a flute/clarinet peg to it.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Holding Tenor Sax
customer_reviews.text: The stand does a great job of holding the sax and without damage to the sax.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Johnson

customer_reviews.title: All the other 5-star reviews hold true, my only con was the lower padded brace is too small - would have loved it to be a bit wi
customer_reviews.text: All the other 5-star reviews hold true, my only con was the lower padded brace is too small - would have loved it to be a bit wider!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy T.

customer_reviews.title: It is very steady
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product, it is easy to unfold and fold back up and is very steady oh, I have used it in over a hundred gigs now and it works well
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Janisch Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a tenor. It folds nicely so I can take it to rehearsal if I want. I leave it up in my music room because I seem to practice more if the horn is already out of the case and sitting there ready to play. The pads protect the finish on the horn so no worries about scratches. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Granddad

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank.
customer_reviews.text: I love Hercules stands, and have nothing but praise for them. Feels like it was made to outlive your career!
customer_reviews.author: Stephan B.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday and he loves it. I didn't think anyone could get that excited about a stand...
customer_reviews.author: Eden G

customer_reviews.title: Sax isn't going anywhere
customer_reviews.text: If you want an industrial-grade stand to hold your sax. This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ciotti

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Found out my old stands were bending up my keys, this stand is adjustable to the bell of your sax which keeps the keys from being bent. Other feature is you can add accessories, nice added value when you double up on different horns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: For my New Sax, this ROCKS! I'll buy the clarinet part soon. Definitely get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: M. Selep

customer_reviews.title: Portable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is my first saxophone stand and it's great. It folds up very nice and holds my Yamaha 62 great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Harden

customer_reviews.title: and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for my tenor sax, and is easy to use. A taller stand might be a little better, so that you don't need to bend so much to lower the sax to the stand. The stand works well though, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality product.
customer_reviews.text: My son really wanted this and even though it cost a few more dollars than the others he was looking at I agreed. It turns out to be a nice, heavy duty stand and folds up nicely. Now I can be sure that his new instrument will not be laid on the ground. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Warren

customer_reviews.title: He says it's amazingly solid and very easily folded up when not in use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a gift for my husband...not knowing much about musical instruments. He really loves the stand. He says it's amazingly solid and very easily folded up when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What's Not to Like?
customer_reviews.text: Let's see....quality materials, clever design, compact size, easy to use, very affordable. Does this sound like a winning combination to you? I've owned almost every brand of saxophone stand on the market and this one is tops, hands down. Even the flute/clarinet peg, if you order one, has a soft covering so that your valuable instruments won't be marred. A saxophone player must have been involved in coming up with this stand because it does everything you want it to do and nothing that you don't want it to do. Well, it may not play a whole-tone scale but that's about the only thing it can't do! Buy it, you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Weise

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand at a Great price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter plays the saxophone in the high school band. After having her sax walked on and broken, we decided a stand was desperately needed. She loves the Hercules stand and the bag is an added bonus. It is sturdy, although lightweight so it is easy to carry around. She says she would definitely recommend this stand to fellow saxophonists!
customer_reviews.author: dakhog

customer_reviews.title: well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is perfect. Both my daughter and my husband play alto sax; my daughter also plays soprano (this has a soprano stand option). it is very sturdy and the feet are rubberized so it doesn't slide.
customer_reviews.author: weeniemobile

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for the money!! Better quality than I thought in the picture....Hercules has good reputation of quality products!!
customer_reviews.author: Geralyn Shea

customer_reviews.title: Best sax stand for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: This is a rugged and compact stand. Best one I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: CasualT

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very sturdy and yet easy to close and store away.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my tenor saxophone (yamaha yts-23) perfectly. Saxophone stays an inch of the floor. Add. bag is a plus too!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent. well built; sturdy and stable. perfect for my beautiful horn.
customer_reviews.author: electroman

customer_reviews.title: Better for tenor than alto.
customer_reviews.text: The bell holder is really big, and my alto rolls around a bit too much for comfort. I wish you could adjust the bell holder for the size of the bell.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Serves it’s purpose
customer_reviews.text: I love this because it’s not bulky and doesn’t take up a lot of room. STURDY!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, stable stand. Perfect for my daughter's alto sax. 10 more words required. 6 more words required. 2 more...
customer_reviews.author: Nowell

customer_reviews.title: My alto sax fell out of this stand. Twice.
customer_reviews.text: Both times, my horn was damaged, which required a trip to the repair shop. This stand has cost me time, money and aggravation. I am throwing it in the trash, where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Shopperman

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: After a single use, I love this stand. Easy sax on and off with no wobble. Metal hinges/hardware. No instructions necessary. The look is very appealing - the yellow hub helps it be seen in a dark venue but it isn't distracting. Maybe a carry bag would be a nice addition, so it can intermingle with the less delicate items in your pile. I can't think of the last time I was so satisfied with a product. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand, maybe someday I'll get my doubling better and can take advantage of the clarinet/flute peg. folds up nicely. bag is good. feels very sturdy on stage around drunk people.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Hardy Stand is a Must Have
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any sax player. This thing is built to last. I have a better chance of leaving it at a gig before it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift. He says it works well. The color (yellow) selection was too bright.
customer_reviews.author: wlthlla

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This stand is rock solid. No 'play' at all. Very pleased with the construction.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: Very good stand, easily folded and unfolded, looks good and professional and does the job. This is a piece of equipment that will not distract you: it does its job well and without fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Perdu

customer_reviews.title: you won't be sorry and so very easy to open up and use
customer_reviews.text: This is my third sax stand and I would tell you to get it ...you won't be sorry and so very easy to open up and use....great stand!!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Great foldable stand.
customer_reviews.text: Could be a little bit lighter, but I do like it. It mostly sits at home and acts as a place to put my sax during practice. I don't take it out often. Works well!
customer_reviews.author: T is for Tech

customer_reviews.title: My tenor lives on this stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, attractive stand that safely stores my tenor on a day-to-day basis. My 3 year-old can mess with the horn while it's on the stand with no fear of tipping, and it's always right at hand so I can work out an idea or relax with some scales. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ford

customer_reviews.title: Alto saxophone stand
customer_reviews.text: This is my Son's second one. Very table and folds up for easier storage
customer_reviews.author: Torcha

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This stand it awesome, works great and displays my brother's sax beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy , NY

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This Hercules DS530B sax stand stand is a great buy. For the price, this value cannot be beat. The stand is sturdy, supports and distributes weight evenly, and easily compacts for travel. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BGS

customer_reviews.title: Great alto sax stand!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who started playing the alto sax. She complained about having to assemble and disassemble her sax to practice. Thought this would encourage more practicing! Easy and fast set up right out of the box. Comes with bag for storage.
customer_reviews.author: KVDM

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like these. I actually have two of them. It holds the sax properly, eliminating the worry of it falling and becoming damaged. Great product
customer_reviews.author: International

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband gets good use of this stand for his saxophones.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff...buy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: So I need 20 words...great product. Bought it for my son who loves it...More of guitar guy myself and I really liked the acoustic stand made by the same folks...Folk on my friends!
customer_reviews.author: outdoorgb

customer_reviews.title: Secure stand.
customer_reviews.text: A very well-made and secure stand for your instrument. It is very portable also.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Made of a strong and heavy metal with lots of rubber in just the right places -- as big bumpers on the floor, and to hold the sax in place. Can't ask for a better stand for the price, or for any price.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Sax Stand
customer_reviews.text: Stand is very sturdy, folds up easily and very compact, so great for travel. Sax looks like a piece of art on the stand, so doesn't take away from the beauty of the instrumnet.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot's wife

customer_reviews.title: Keep your horn happy
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this stand and it is very handy. Helps air out the horn versus being in the case, and it is easy to assemble and disassemble. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: W. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping your instrument handy, safe and secure.
customer_reviews.text: Using this stand is a great way to keep your instrument handy, safe and secure. The stand arrived promptly. Great purchase, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aussiebrum

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy the newer Herc stand, the locking legs give added security and protection against accidental falls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Hold my alto and tenor saxes (separately) when I'm not using them. I also own the double stand and that functions great too!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny O

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it to buy Hercules!
customer_reviews.text: My son got a very expensive sax and this came soon after. It is very secure and it is so nice not have to set a multi-thousand dollar sax anywhere not safe. Its worth the money to buy a Hercules.
customer_reviews.author: Marigold Mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best instrument rack ever, folds to take up minimal space and works like there is no tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: JCFH

customer_reviews.title: A tough stand
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a valuable old sax, and this one keeps it safe while he picks up his clarinet. Excellent for kids, we got them for our grandsons too.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Munson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time. The product is working as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Theophrastus

customer_reviews.title: strong and stable
customer_reviews.text: Strong and stable. What more could you want? Also it'll fold down small. I use it with a tenor. I've never knocked it over.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kurt Tidmore

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy.  This stand in great!
customer_reviews.text: The Hercules alto/tenor sax stand is very well built and easy to use. All you have to do is unfold it and make sure that the metal pins are locked to secure it. I like the foam padding on the stand which protects the finish on saxophones. This stand doesnt appear to be as large as other stands I have seen in the past. The stand is compact so you can take it with you anywhere. A must for every sax player.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D. Yorgason

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: Nice and stable and I was surprised to discover it is flexible to accept add on stands for a saprano or other instrument. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Safest Stand
customer_reviews.text: The Hercules DS530B Alto/Tenor Sax Stand that I purchased from Amazon has a kind calming effect on me (and I suspect most saxophonists). It seems that if you get the horn anywhere near the stand, the Hercules will reach out and grab it in its strong secure arms. The horn doesn't rotate or slip and that means a safe, secure horn.
customer_reviews.author: A. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Saxophone stand
customer_reviews.text: The Hercules Alto sax stand is exactly what I had in mind. It is easy to adjust, is sturdy, and keeps the instrument safely in position.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome stand. The best feature is the fact that it colapses very small and two of the neatly fit in my tenor sax gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: DaRhino

customer_reviews.title: Good Item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece and I had no complaints from my sister in law, it means it's a good quality item
customer_reviews.author: Jose Li Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect such a high quality for such a reasonable price. I would highly recommend this stand to any body.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Piero Pavone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Fits tenor sax well. Like the carrying bag!
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and functional
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I was so tired of my daughter's sax lying around because she did not want to take it apart. This is perfect for getting it out of the way. Good quality & functional.
customer_reviews.author: Isis

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is probably one of the finest I have ever used. .Sturdy, adjustable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis D. Kocher

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy stand. Not wobbly. My Tenor Sax fits on the stand with no issues. The bottom of the horn is quite close to the floor, but I don't see it as an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella  Jean Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Great saxophone stand!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to transport and set up! I love the small footprint and the sturdiness of this stand
customer_reviews.author: Polomom

product_meta.title: Hercules DS530B Alto/Tenor Saxophone Stand
product_meta.description:
Size:UNITSThe Folding Yoke holds your Alto/Tenor saxophone securely on the stand and the adjustable backrest accommodates both Alto and Tenor sax. There are 2 extra peg holes on the legs, allowing you store other instruments without using extra floor space (see available pegs) Swivel Legs fit around other equipment. Weight: 1. 1 kg (2. 3lbs) 
Folded size: 310x140mm (12. 2x5. 5 ")
feature_bullets: Holds your Alto/Tenor saxophone securely on the stand
Adjustable backrest accommodates both Alto and Tenor sax
2 extra peg holes on the legs lets you store other instruments without using extra floorspace
Swivel Legs fit around other equipment
